intro: Barbacenia retinervis, commonly known as the silverleaf barbacenia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. Barbacenia retinervis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and attractive blooms.
